image.altText: Ninette Simons with severe facial bruising some days after the attack.

props.synopsis: A former detainee released after a landmark immigration High Court ruling is charged over a violent home invasion in Perth.

title.children: Former immigration detainee released in wake of High Court decision arrested after brutal home invasion

image.altText: Sarah Wilson turns away in tears as Anthony Albanese addresses a rally outside parliament house

props.synopsis: It was meant to be a moment in which Anthony Albanese joined with tens of thousands of people nationally to demand an end to men's violence. The result was an organiser in tears, accusations of lying and the prime minister making a hasty exit.

title.children: An organiser in tears, accusations of lying and a PM in a hurried exit

image.altText: A group of buildings at Risdon Prison

props.synopsis: Five prisoners have died by suicide in Hobart's Risdon Prison in the past decade, with Robert Harold Gerard among them. A coroner hears Gerard missed a psychiatric assessment weeks earlier because the only psychiatrist was on leave.

title.children: After another Hobart prisoner took their life, coroner told inmate mental health services 'lowest in any developed country'

image.altText: Canberra gendered violence rally

props.synopsis: A series of gendered violence deaths has brought a moment of fresh national reckoning. With it has come renewed scrutiny on the actions of governments. What is their plan?

title.children: There is renewed scrutiny on the government's gendered violence plan. What is it?

image.altText: A young woman of Asian background standing in a doorway

props.synopsis: Authorities say new scam figures show their action on scams is working — but consumer groups and devastated victims say it's nowhere near enough.

title.children: 'My body was shaking': The fake text message that led to Jenny's family losing their savings

image.altText: Police stand outside a home with with police tape.

props.synopsis: Police say emergency services were called to a home at Boolaroo just before 4pm on Monday.

title.children: Ten-year-old girl dies after being stabbed, 17-year-old arrested

image.altText: A Parliament House in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: It's Tasmania's answer to 'Super Saturday'. Three upper house elections on the same day could further shape parliament – and further complicate Jeremy Rockliff's legislative agenda.

title.children: Tasmania has another three elections this weekend. They could cause more headaches for the Liberals

image.altText: Man wearing black t-shirt and pants looking at camera walking into court with woman with red file

props.synopsis: Broome tradesman Matej Radelic has pleaded not guilty to aggravated common assault after being accused of restraining three children with cable ties after he found them swimming in a pool at a vacant property.

title.children: Broome man accused of restraining children with cable ties pleads not guilty

image.altText: sad woman looks out window

props.synopsis: About 16 per cent of women will have vulva pain that lasts longer than three months, and many of them "just put up with it".

title.children: 'A lot of women just put up with it': Understanding vulvodynia

image.altText: Leila and Sean

props.synopsis: Leila McDougall has been defying the odds since childhood. She’s overcome dyslexia, beaten cancer, and after sneaking into acting school, has written, produced and starred in a feature film to help her farming community.

title.children: Leila noticed her tiny town was suffering. So she took a $500k risk to make a difference

image.altText: Jacinta Allan sits, looking serious, at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has appeared at the Yoorrook Justice Commission, becoming the first leader of an Australian government to give evidence at a formal truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: Victorian premier says she didn't know of brutal massacres of Aboriginal people near her home

image.altText: A boy stands on a beach. His face is blurred.

props.synopsis: The parents of the 16-year-old who stabbed a Sydney bishop have spoken publicly for the first time, painting a picture of a vulnerable and violent child with serious anger management issues, longstanding mental health concerns and suspected autism spectrum disorder.

title.children: Parents of teenage terror accused detail frantic hours before attack on bishop

image.altText: A woman is seen through the windshield of a car at night. She has her hands on the wheel. A child is in the back seat.

props.synopsis: A growing crisis of school refusal is gripping Australia, leaving families in a hidden struggle with blame, shame and the fear of a lost education.

title.children: Alice can't get her daughter to school. She knows you're judging her for it

image.altText: Image of Craig McPherson.

props.synopsis: Network Seven's director of news and current affairs Craig McPherson has quit after a tumultuous few weeks for the media company.

title.children: 7 News director Craig McPherson quits following a tumultuous few weeks for the network

image.altText: Police tape in front of a home.

props.synopsis: Donald Morley, who has been diagnosed with a terminal illness, is sentenced to nine years in jail after suffocating his 92-year-old wife, Jean Morley, in their Fisher home last year.

title.children: 'Murder remains murder': Terminally ill Canberra man jailed for nine years for murdering his 92yo wife

image.altText: An aerial shot of the closed Ravensthorpe nickel mine

props.synopsis: Canadian miner First Quantum Minerals says the Ravensthorpe Nickel Mine will close this week, with 330 jobs to be made redundant.

title.children: Ravensthorpe nickel mine to close with loss of more than 300 jobs

image.altText: A close up of a man surrounded by rocks. He's wearing a caving helmet with a light. It looks cramped.

props.synopsis: The world of fossil collecting is much more DIY than you might think. Pitch black caves, weekend trips and volunteer spelunkers are "critically important" for scientific research.

title.children: 'No-one's ever been there before': How a team of cavers helped rescue a decaying 50,000-year-old kangaroo skeleton

image.altText: Ab lack-and-white image of a young blonde woman.

props.synopsis: New evidence is set to be heard at an inquest into the 1994 disappearance and presumed death of Sydney escort, model and dancer Revelle Balmain.

title.children: 'High-pitched female scream' heard on night 22-year-old model went missing, inquest hears

image.altText: A woman with three children.

props.synopsis: Thousands of cases are lodged in the state tribunals and relevant courts every year. Case delays during the COVID-19 period have seen some states left with a significant backlog on top of the new cases.

title.children: Aussie renters are getting more clued up about their rights and for some that means going to a tribunal

image.altText: Smashed windows of a taxi parked on the street.

props.synopsis: Recent incidents of vandalism and violence has shaken Hobart's taxi workforce — and they've had enough. It's an issue the Multicultural Council of Tasmania says needs a 'collective effort' to fix.

title.children: Hobart taxi drivers left 'mentally stressed' and 'not feeling safe' in face of repeated antisocial behaviour

image.altText: Strike it Out founder Kirsten Ritchie

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian charity has spent years and more than $100,000 constructing sleeping pods to be used as crisis accommodation for people experiencing homelessness. But the charity says they're still waiting on council support.

title.children: These 'sleeping pods' could provide accommodation for homeless people, but they're sitting empty

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue suit speaks to media, holding microphones, at a scrum outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent rugby league journalist Paul Kent is stood down from his roles as a Fox presenter and News Corp columnist "pending an immediate investigation" by his employers into footage from a late-night fight on a Sydney street.

title.children: Man charged over fight with prominent sports journalist Paul Kent on Sydney street

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try in an NRL match

props.synopsis: As Daly Cherry-Evans faces the first suspension of his 308 game NRL career, Manly has called for the league to introduce a good behaviour discount for players who face the judiciary.

title.children: Manly calls for judiciary overhaul as Daly Cherry-Evans faces first suspension of 14-year career

image.altText: A composite image  showing a man in a hospital bed and a woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: After a Four Corners investigation exposed safety issues with spinal cord stimulators, more patients have come forward to share their experiences of complications from the devices or the procedures to install them.

title.children: 'I thought I was going to die': More horror stories are emerging about spinal cord stimulators

image.altText: A composite photo of two smiling toddlers.

props.synopsis: An inquest is examining the deaths of two-and-a-half-year-old Darcey-Helen and her 13-month-old sister Chloe-Ann at Waterford West in November 2019.

title.children: Logan mother who left toddlers to die inside hot car was repeatedly reported to child safety, inquiry hears

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wearing a hard hat and a high-visibility bib at a construction site in Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has returned to Alice Springs for the first time since the town hit the national spotlight when a youth curfew was imposed in a bid to curb social unrest.

title.children: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visits Alice Springs for first time since youth curfew

image.altText: A blonde woman in a gold and sparkly dress speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Nicole Kidman is the first Australian to receive the prestigious film award.

title.children: Nicole Kidman 'makes movies better': Is she our most successful actress?

image.altText: Ms Calgaret smiles in a portrait-framed photograph.

props.synopsis: Heather Calgaret was months from completing a sentence for armed robbery when she died in November 2021. How the 30-year-old Yamatji, Noongar, Wongi and Pitjantjatjara woman's life ended will be examined in a four-week coronial inquest starting today.

title.children: Loved ones of Aboriginal woman who died in custody remember her as the 'rock' of her family

image.altText: A composite of Mehreen Faruqi in a yellow shirt and green blazer next to Pauline Hanson with a finger near her mouth in bluel

props.synopsis: Senator Hanson's lawyer has told the court Greens senator Mehreen Faruqi's initial tweet was intended to "offend and provoke a response".

title.children: Greens senator's racial discrimination trial told One Nation's Pauline Hanson is a 'well-known sayer of racist things'

image.altText: A man looks to pass the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Veteran Roosters pivot Luke Keary has announced 2024 will be his final season in the NRL with the three-time premiership winner to hang up the boots at the end of the year.

title.children: Three-time NRL premiership winner Luke Keary announces retirement at end of 2024 season

image.altText: Aerial photo of buildings that have been destroyed by a tornado.

props.synopsis: Footage posted by Chinese state media shows widespread devastation in southern city of Guangzhou after a tornado swept through the day before, killing five people, injuring dozens others and damaging more than 140 buildings.

title.children: Deadly tornado in China's Guangzhou kills five, injures dozens and damages more than 140 buildings

image.altText: The back of a person's head. They are wearing a telephone headset.

props.synopsis: Queensland police are warning people to stay vigilant about investment fraud after dozens of people were allegedly defrauded. The accused parties had their cases mentioned in a Gold Coast court today.

title.children: Money laundering charges laid after alleged cold call scam nets $1.5m

image.altText: David Foster in front of blank background during the NSW Independent Casino Commission’s 2024 Independent Inquiry into The Star

props.synopsis: In a statement to the ASX the company announced that David Foster had been replaced by Anne Ward as chairman of the board, effective immediately.

title.children: Star board chairman replaced days after 'prepping for war' text message revealed in casino regulator hearing

image.altText: Back of the head of a girl standing in front of blurred Maffra Secondary College sign

props.synopsis: Every couple of months Emily* faces racism by her peers at school, targeting her Indigenous heritage. The "hurtful" slurs have impacted on her wellbeing.

title.children: After joining a school in regional Victoria, Emily felt 'embarrassed and upset' about her Indigenous heritage

image.altText: A man speaks into a row of microphones in front of a white banner advertising the Variety charity.

props.synopsis: Former Adelaide Crows captain Rory Sloane announces his retirement from the AFL after 255 games over 16 seasons, following a second round of surgery on a detached retina earlier this year.

title.children: Crows star renowned for on-field courage admits he was 'spooked' by detached retina risk
